answers.answer: I’m a founder of 4 companies, I work remotely for all my startups which are based out of the U.K. I founded my first company when I was 18 years old
I’m working with an acquisition that will be finishing in a few weeks. It’s really exciting to be working with a brand that’ll change the way people will view the market of health.
Each of my companies have different channels where their social works best, but without a doubt for most of my startups it’s Instagram. Other channels that do well is Pinterest and LinkedIn.
Time management. All my day is planned out perfectly by the minute but it still gets difficult managing 4 companies and 2 kids.
Educate yourself. Research, actively become part of the conversation, get creative, have fun.
Completing my to do list every day!
Worked my way up from a non CS background to being the founder of my own company.
I'll soon be expanding to other countries and I'm really excited about that!
LinkedIn works best to build contacts with other like minded individuals, and Facebook works best for paid advertising.
I'm learning AI and trying to see if it's fit for my company and if I need to hire an AI Engineer.
I'm measuring my company's success instead of my own, because I'm only successful as much as my company.
My biggest goal is to expand to atleast 5-10 different companies and to make sure that all my employees are as successful as the company.
I founded Clarke Management, an end to end Fashion Management Agency after working for 5 years in the fashion industry as a model.
Exceeding expectations of our customers in terms of brand building, while making sure our models love their work.
Instagram works really well because all our clients and models are on Instagram. But it usually depends on the type of project we are working on and the goal we want to achieve.
Making an inclusive action plan following the basics principles Segmenting, Targeting, Positioning.
Measuring the effectiveness of strategies and their implementation at all levels.
Don't be afraid to experiment and take risks in whatever work you do.
Return on Investment, because profitability gives you more flexibility to experiment.
My biggest obstacle is making a profit, even if we have 200% growth in a quarter, keeping afloat is always a problem.
I founded Arc Software, an end to end software development company after working for 25 years in the software industry.
Making sure our customer's love our work completely.
Instagram works really well because all our clients are on Instagram.
Making an inclusive action plan following the basics principles Segmenting, Targeting, Positioning.
Measuring the effectiveness of strategies and their implementation at all levels.
Don't be afraid to experiment and take risks in whatever work you do.
Our key metric is just happiness. Our customer's happiness and employees happiness, because that's the end goal of life, right? To be happy.
My biggest obstacle is connecting with B2B clients, because the gestation period is a lot.
